snippet: Ford Center at the Star in Frisco, Tex., will house the team’s headquarters, training center, offices and a 12,000-seat indoor stadium that will be shared with area high schools.
abstract: Ford Center at the Star, new Dallas Cowboys headquarters in Frisco, Tex, will include training facility, practice fields, offices and indoor stadium that will be shared with eight local high schools; project, which also includes entertainment and retail district, is being built by Blue Star Land, development company owned by family of team's owner Jerry Jones.
lead_paragraph: Ford Center at the Star in Frisco, Tex., will house the team’s headquarters, training center, offices and a 12,000-seat indoor stadium that will be shared with area high schools.

headline.main: Cowboys’ Star on the Rise in a Dallas Suburb
headline.print_headline: Cowboys’ Star on the Rise in a Dallas Suburb
